141B: Lesson 6

Plotting

Matplotlib

So we have all seen plotting in R, matlab, excel, etc. Matplotlib is the premier python package for plotting, created by the late John Hunter, and it is compatible with Numpy and Pandas. It has extensive 2D plotting functions, some 3D plotting, and extensions for geographical data (which we will go over later in the class). The common 2D plots that we commonly make are plot, scatter, hist, bar, pie, boxplot, contours. You can also draw basic objects on the plot, like lines, polygons, etc. but we won't be going over this in this lesson.

Checkpoint: Look through the gallery of examples and descend into those that you find interesting. Also, look through the list of methods in pyplot to see what is available.

Follow along with the following example with the notebook.
Matplotlib: plot, errorbar, stackplot

Checkpoint: look at the arguments for the following commands in pyplot:

  • plot
  • errorbar
  • stackplot
  • scatter
Matplotlib: scatter, hist

Checkpoint: look at the arguments for the following commands in pyplot:

  • hist
  • bar
  • pie
  • boxplot
  • violinplot
  • subplots
Matplotlib: bar, pie, boxplot, violinplot, subplots
